snippet: The dangers of procrastination are clear. But a study shows that many people are “precrastinators,” finishing projects sooner than is needed and thus causing a different kind of problem.
abstract: Matt Richtel Applied Science column; study in Psychological Science shows that many people are 'precrastinators,' finishing projects sooner than is needed and thus causing a different kind of problem than procrastination; says behavior is irrational choice that reflects significant trade-offs people make to keep from feeling overwhelmed.
lead_paragraph: The dangers of procrastination are clear. But a study shows that many people are “precrastinators,” finishing projects sooner than is needed and thus causing a different kind of problem.

headline.main: Sometimes, Early Birds Are Too Early
headline.print_headline: Sometimes, Early Birds Are Too Early
